DataElement.preferredName: Blood Specimen Abnormal Laboratory Finding Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to abnormal hematology laboratory finding.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Specimen Abnormal Granulocyte Laboratory Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to abnormal laboratory finding for leucocytes with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.:A leucocyte with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules. In humans the granulocytes are also classified as polymorphonuclear leucocytes and are subdivided according to the staining properties of the granules into eosinophils, basophils and neutrophils. (from On-line Medical Dictionary):The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

A type of leukocyte with a multilobed nucleus and cytoplasmic granules. The unique morphology of the nucleus has led to their also being known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes (PMLs or PMNs). Granulocytes are subdivided according to the staining properties of their granules into eosinophils (red with acidic dye), basophils (blue with basic dye), and neutrophils (not amenable to staining with either acidic or basic dyes).
The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the post-operative absolut
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the post-operative absolute granulocyte count (AGC)>= 1500/mm^3 (or >= 1200/mm^3 if, in the opinion of the investigator, this represents an ethnic or racial variant of normal?
